page.title: 03VETERINARY SURGERY.
page.content: The house,The Gables,was built in 1884,100 years later Mr.Murray, Mr.Turner and Mr.Taylor bought the house & opened a branch practice.It was intended to serve pet owners of Worcester.Large numbers of dogs & cats are brought from Worcester & surrounding villages.Later in 1938 a 2nd branch was opened in Ledbury,& a 3rd branch in Malvern in 1951. The main treatments involve vaccinations,speying & accident victims,eg being run over by a car or farm machine accidents.The worst injury for a cat is to get its intestines mixed up with its lungs.The simplest injury is being bitten by another cat.The worst injury for a dog is for its stomach to inflate & twist. Between 40 & 90 pets a day come to the surgery.The Worcester branch employs 2 surgeons & 4 nurses.
